advantage.name: Mind Speech
advantage.description: The creature is able to communicate with people within a given range via telepathy. It cannot read anything other than their surface thoughts. Communication requires a shared language to be used.

advantage.name: Undead
advantage.description: An undead creature is a walking corpse, animated through supernatural means. Undead do not need to eat, drink or breath. They are difficult to kill, since they do no have vital organs. An undead has twice the normal number of wound and stun levels. They often have abnormal stamina (nine), above average strength, and low will.

advantage.name: Incorporeal
advantage.description: An incorporeal creature has no physical body, and hence no direct way to affect the physical world. They have no wound or stun levels, and no soak, since they cannot be harmed physically. An incorporeal may attack by draining the energy from people, causing fatigue levels. When attacking, it only requires to touch the individual - a parry is useless. Damage uses its will x 4 instead of strength, and the target uses their will x 4 for soaking.
